reviews.review_msg: DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS I took this class as an easy A because I was in French immersion for 6 years and this course was tough even for me (semi fluet) She talked in French almost the entire class expecting everyone to understand her when very few did. You have oral exams paired with a random student and if they mess up you lose marks because of it.

You can't really know until you're in there if shes teaching, it won't say when you sign up for the course. She's very kind but if you actually want to learn the subject she's not the teacher for you. She has trouble explaining things and isn't very good at actually teaching. She often made things much more complicated than really needed.

He is by far the best French prof at SFU. He uses immersive-style teaching, meaning he tells you why the grammar is as such instead of just following the textbook. Class is so chill and full of jokes. You cannot go wrong with this guy.
super easy tests and material. preps you well for them. she'll also mark ur comp twice and give u a higher mark. nice prof
Not an enthusiastic teacher at all. Her tests are fair game because she makes sure she covers everything we need to know. Class is pretty easy just make sure you keep up with it.

I really like her! She's nice, always willing to help, friendly, understanding, tries her best to teach. But it would have been much better if her english was better (esp for this intro 2 course). But overall I really enjoyed the course with her!

The great thing about Paola is that she understands that learning a foreign language is -hard-.  That's not to say it's an easy class or anything, just that she can understand where her students are coming from, and is always happy to help.

Honestly the best professor I've ever had. Passionate about teaching and he will use different approaches for students at different levels to understand. Great atmosphere.. you'll walk out of the class saying bye to every single person. I've had two courses with him with great results, and I hope to see him in upper level courses! TAKE IT!
